attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
This year it's been proved more than ever before that our lads and lassies are not forgotten but are being thought about by so many people.

At its worst, it informs the attitudes of the most unthinking of ordinary people: who could forget the disgraceful objections in Ashtead last year to the opening of a charitable house that would allow the families of severely injured servicemen to stay near their loved ones?

Our Government's shoddy treatment of our forces is, it seems, exceeded only by its abandonment of the elderly. Old people, rather like soldiers, often have the misfortune to be trapped in an institution that the Government would rather ignore. 

The British Army is, of course, an institution that is widely renowned and respected abroad for its efficiency and courage. Its prevailing tragedy is that it is not respected by our Goverment.

rejection.details: Please specify what exactly you wish the Government to do.
reasons: Wording that needs to be amended, or is impossible to understand
Statements that don't actually request any action
